intro: Englerina inaequilatera, commonly known as the unequal-sided engleria, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
